div.p: REMPHAN the Authorized Version’s rendering of the Greek word variously appearing in Acts vii. 48 as 'Ρομφά, 'Ρεμφάν, 'Ρεμφάμ, 'Ραιφάν, 'Ρεφάν. It is part of a quotation from Amos V. 26, where the .Septuagint 'Ραιφάν or 'Ρεφάν stands

for the Hebrew P*9 Chuin or Kewan. The Greek forms are probably simple mistakes for the Hebrew, k (°) having been replaced by r (">) and ph (φ) substituted for v (’)· Kewan is probably the old Babylonian Ka(y)awanu, the planet Saturn, another (the Akkadian) name for which is Sakkut, which appears as Siccuth in the earlier part of the verse.
